result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • James E. Boos was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney James Lex (specially).  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Probation P.B. - Statements by Dunphy - Statements by Lex - Court finds the defendant has served his one year - JOC should state the conditional jail time has been served - 
15CF180 - Arguments by Dunphy/Lex to bail modification - Court denies motion to reduce bond on this case - Remains at $500 cash with $1500 sig and all conditions remain
Hearing at 03-01-2016 03:30 pm
agreement for modification to conditions of probation - 45 days jail w/o huber - court signs the request.
Request/Agreement for Modification to conditions of Probation - Box for approved needed to be "X'd".

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sara from DOC is also present in court.  Case called and appearances given.  DOC is requesting an additional 45 days due to rule violation with the no contact.    Court signs the order for an additional 45 days.
Hearing at 08-05-2015 03:30 pm
Tina Abernethy-Mays
agreement for modification to conditions of probation.  15 days jail w/o huber Signed by the court.

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 10:31 am Appearances given at 10:31 am.  Arguements heard regarding 15 day rule violation from probation.  The court orders to put this issue on hold do to an on going investigation into the letters.  Court directs the probation agent to schedule something with the court after the investigation is complete.  Court orders the 15 days additional jail time.  Court signs signs the probation order for the 15 days.  Court denies any credit at this time.  Defense addresses the jail being served in increments.  Court needs more information on the enrollment in school.
Hearing at 07-15-2015 10:00 am

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft does not want to sign the revocation papers.  Dept of corrections is present in court.  Case called and Appearances given by the State at 11:07 pm.  Dept of Corrections addresses the court. Court addresses the deft regarding an attorney. Do to the rule violations the conditional jail time is to start immediatly.  Deft wants an attorney in regards to the 15 days additional.  Court agrees that the conditional jail time is to begin today.  The jail would have to verify that the deft is enrolled full time in school.  The deft would have to provide the documentation to the jail staff.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Associated with Charge #1

Deft enters a plea of guilty to count 1(5th offense) , Counts 2-4 - DRI   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of 36 months, beginning on _6/4/15, each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of 36 months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.
NOT  Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & IS eligible for Substance Abuse programs
